not finding too much, you could try disabling acpi to test
add:   acpi=off   in the quotes in /etc/default/grub    you will need to run:  sudo update-grub    to apply the setting
i opened grub but where to put acpi=off in that file? it will not affect system boot?
yes, it will make acpi not be loaded
but the grub is full of data. where to put acpi=off exactly?
GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT="quiet splash"   change it to    GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT="quiet splash acpi=off"
the file is outside home, you need to run:  gksudo gedit /etc/default/grub   to get write access
ANY file outside of your home that you need write access to, use sudo or gksudo (gksudo if you intend to use graphical apps to edit / manipulate the data)
